<!-- Please only use this template for submitting enhancement requests -->

When deploying kubernetes in AWS cloud provider it is assumed the AWS cloud is not disconnected [1]. In case the assumption is violated, the deployment fails as the default configuration sets the default endpoint DNS suffix to `amazonaws.com` [2].

**What would you like to be added**:

Extend the aws cloud provider initialization with configurable aws DNS suffix endpoint. Currently, the code creates a session (by invoking `session.NewSession(&aws.Config{})`, see [3]) that could be extended into:

```go
sess, err := session.NewSession(&aws.Config{
	EndpointResolver: endpoints.ResolverFunc(myCustomResolver),
})
```

as described in [4]. There are other places where the change needs to be applied:
- for `LoadBalancing`: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f2c9eb860fd89acab5d587122ff77d8bf013b9b7/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/aws/aws.go#L673
- for `Autoscaling`: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f2c9eb860fd89acab5d587122ff77d8bf013b9b7/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/aws/aws.go#L708
- others

**Why is this needed**:

So the Kubernetes can be deployed in air-gapped AWS regions.

**Links**

[1] https://digitalageexperts.com/how-are-aws-private-air-gapped-regions-different/
[2] https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/blob/475409399d0f8a680b6c68fcd49be984e36d5d66/aws/endpoints/defaults.go#L212
[3] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/f2c9eb860fd89acab5d587122ff77d8bf013b9b7/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/aws/aws.go#L959
[4] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-go/api/aws/endpoints/
